definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: By that time, countries were looking with eager interest at financial models developed elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 当时，有好些国家对别国的金融模式看着眼热。

definition: to water at the mouth/to drool
lit. itchy heart/to be itching to do sth (idiom)
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to raise eyebrows/to cast sidelong glances (expressing fear or indignation)/shocked/surprised
to admire/to hold in high esteem
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
to drool (over) (idiom)/to yearn for/to covet/to crave
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
